creator: 6137970@swin.edu.au
text:
Created attachment 22758
Bug screenshot

This bug occurs when user installs 2 different versions of Apache web server and then uninstalls one which has older version. The uninstalled version is still displayed as if it exists but cannot be run.

Steps to reproduce:
  1. Download Apache HTTP Server 2.2.10 - Win32 Binary including OpenSSL 0.9.8i (MSI Installer) and Apache HTTP Server 2.0.63 - Win32 Binary including OpenSSL 0.9.7m (MSI Installer) from following link: http://httpd.apache.org/download.cgi
  2. Install Apache HTTP server 2.0.63.
  3. Install Apache HTTP server 2.2.10.
  4. Uninstall Apache HTTP server 2.0.63.
  5. Open Apache Monitor, you can see that Apache 2.0.63 still be listed there but it cannot be run.

See the attachment for screenshot of the bug.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
Because a reboot was required since the service was changed multiple times
within the session.  Often the windows SCM doesn't sync these changes.
